page.title: 02Avon Livestock Centre
page.content: My mum gets to the market at 9.00am. At that time there is a queue of lorries as each driver waits to be given a pen and lot numbers for his animals - cows, pigs, sheep or calves. The buyers come from a long way, some as far as Cornwall, so when my mum gets there they are often in the canteen having breakfast. They have the main sales one after the other because some people like to buy more than one kind of animal. A good auctioneer can sell very fast and when the buyers have bought their animals they go to my mum to pay for them. She also has to give them the lot numbers and ear numbers so that they can find the animals in the pens later, and take them home. Sometimes the animals get muddled up but not very often. It is very noisy and very busy and no-one has time to stop for dinner. cont(P10)
